title: Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis (PSC)
diagnosis_topic: Chronic progressive cholestatic liver disease with inflammation and fibrosis of intra- and extrahepatic bile ducts
setup_script: A 35-year-old man with a history of ulcerative colitis presents with fatigue, pruritus and elevated liver enzymes. He denies alcohol use.

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 118/75 mmHg, HR 90 bpm, RR 16/min, Temp 36.6 C.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders liver function tests
dynamic_flow.reply: Elevated alkaline phosphatase and gamma-glutamyl transferase with mildly elevated bilirubin; AST/ALT normal or mildly elevated.
Multifocal strictures and segmental dilatations of intrahepatic and extrahepatic bile ducts giving a beaded appearance characteristic of PSC.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident evaluates for autoimmune markers
dynamic_flow.reply: p-ANCA positive; negative anti-mitochondrial antibody (rules out primary biliary cholangitis).
No curative medical therapy; treat pruritus with cholestyramine; evaluate for vitamin deficiencies.
Annual MRCP or ultrasound and CA 19-9 levels; risk increased in PSC.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident monitors for dominant strictures
dynamic_flow.reply: Endoscopic dilation and stenting if symptomatic.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident addresses indication for liver transplantation
dynamic_flow.reply: Development of liver failure, intractable pruritus or recurrent cholangitis.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident discusses concomitant inflammatory bowel disease
dynamic_flow.reply: Colonoscopy surveillance every 1-2 years due to increased colorectal cancer risk.
Median survival from diagnosis approximately 10-15 years without transplantation.
Importance of vaccination against hepatitis A and B and avoidance of hepatotoxic agents.
Referral to centers investigating new therapies (e.g., ursodeoxycholic acid high dose, obeticholic acid).

critical_decision_points: Diagnosis of PSC using cholestatic liver enzymes and MRCP
Lack of effective medical therapy and management of symptoms
Screening for complications such as cholangiocarcinoma and colorectal cancer
Timing of liver transplantation and management of dominant strictures
Patient education on prognosis, vaccinations and lifestyle modifications
